intro: Trochocarpa pumila, commonly known as the dwarf rock fig, is a small, shrub-like plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Moraceae, which includes figs and mulberries, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are typically green when mature, though they may change color depending on the species. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
